title: Ch.. ch.. ch.. chair
body: Yes, it's true. We've decided to use standard theater seating instead of sofas and chairs. I'll explain in a future post, but for right now, here's what you need to know: these chairs were salvaged from an old theater in Flagstaff, Arizona. I think they hail from the 50s or later. They're fairly small, but in great condition. They're made out of aluminum, and sit quite near to the ground, which is good in a level floor auditorium. The guy we're buying them from has 1,400 of them stored in a warehouse in Springfield. He looks just like Jon Voight and he's awesome, but more on that later. Here's what the chairs will look like: Notice the condition these chairs are in. Everything's 100% original. A lot of them have seat numbers on the front, but they'll peel off with little difficulty. Here's a nice shot of the backside. No dents, no mars, no gum, no nothing! These chairs are SWEET! The bottom of the seat is roughly five inches of nice plush foam. The upholstery is a redish / orangish affair that will look great in our dark auditorium. Here's an action shot of a typical customer watching a thriller... with a dog. Here's an action shot of a typical customer watching a comedy... with a dog. Here's an action shot of a typical customer watching a drama... with a dog.
author: Dan

comments.author: Stephanie
comments.body:

comments.body: what would be pretty funny is if you put wheels on them and slanted the theater floor. then everyone would just roll down to the front under screen and get bunched up there.

comments.author: Jimmy
comments.body: I think they absolutely look great.  Hasn't the, um, average butt gotten significantly wider since the 1950s, though?

comments.author: Dave Adams
comments.body:
Yeah.  Dan and Nicole are too skinny!

Actually, Dan, the chairs look fantastic!

comments.author: WhimsyChick
comments.body:
In my hometown, the community theatre holds its shows in a very old building with very old seats. In the warmer months, the red seats tend to bleed onto light colored clothing with just a bit of body heat and perspiration.

Have you checked if these spiffy seats are colorfast?

comments.author: Fyse
comments.body: I've gotta agree with Jimmy's point. Is the Moxie gonna have trouble accomodating larger film-goers in these chairs?

comments.author: justin
comments.body: Fat people shouldn't be allowed to see movies.  Although, they'll probably spend more at the Cine Bar.  Did I say that out loud?

comments.author: Nicholas
comments.body: Dan, if you can fit 1400 seats into the Moxie I'll pee myself and record it for all to see. speaking of recordings, if you have the footage from the interview I'll gladly digitize it for you and encode in RM, QT, WM, or whatever you need...

comments.body: Why peel off the numbers?  It gives the chairs Moxie.  Maybe I can incorporate a moxie joke into every comment.
